intro: Ononis inaperta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, pink to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Ononis inaperta is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions, making it a hardy species in disturbed or dry habitats.
